page.title: 01Verwood Village,Dorset.
page.content: Settlement in the Verwood area seems to have started along the banks of the River Crane which was probably used for watering stock.Verwood Village, Three Legged Cross and Romford becoming small unimportant hamlets on the out-skirts of Cranborne Chase. Most of the earliest inhabitants of the area would have been farm labourers although some of the villagers had trades.Blacksmiths, carpenters,shoemakers and thatchers were found:basket and broom-makers established their trades at Three Legged Cross and potteries,making bricks,tiles or pottery vessels grew up around sources of local clay. The oldest dwellings found in the area are thatched cob cottages,their white-washed walls built of clay,straw and gravel, perhaps 500 years ago.
